meanings.definition: The act of placing or positioning someone or something in a particular location.
meanings.sent1: The stationing of the new sculpture in the park drew a lot of attention.
meanings.sent2: The stationing of the guard at the entrance ensured security for the event.
meanings.sent3: The stationing of the cat on the bookshelf made for a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The stationing of the sun in the sky marked the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The stationing of the colorful flags along the street made the town look festive.

meanings.definition: The state of being stationed or stationed somewhere.
meanings.sent1: The stationing of the troops along the border was a strategic move.
meanings.sent2: His stationing in the remote village allowed him to experience a different way of life.
meanings.sent3: The stationing of the squirrel in the birdhouse caused quite a stir among the birds.
meanings.sent4: The stationing of the moon in the night sky created a tranquil atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The stationing of the lighthouse on the cliff guided ships safely through the night.
